"On the first, they saw the comet"...(?)...
=C2=A0
Yes, it sounds perfectly=
 clear to me. 
=C2=A0
At first I thought the word=C2=A0"comet" might also s=
ound a bit=C2=A0like (they saw/the/m) "COMING", but after multiple listenin=
gs I can definitely hear the hard "t" and sharp ending=C2=A0with this=C2=A0=
message. 
=C2=A0
It drops of too quickly to be anything ending with "ing" (=
or so I seem to hear). ;)
=C2=A0
You shouldn't quit anything, you! 
=C2=A0
=
There's lots of times when you and other members hear things in my own (and=
 others) recordings that I just don't get at all. It happens. The first tim=
e I heard Edison's voice was on a clip that=C2=A0I was mis-interpreting and=
 you=C2=A0pointed out for me=C2=A0(!). After that I couldn't even hear the =
original message as I had first heard it. 
=C2=A0
To end, I'm learning a lo=
t from listening to the files that you and Frank and our other members subm=
it for review and I notice two completely different styles and sounds in th=
e messages both of you (and all of us) tend to look for and feel attracted/=
drawn to. I usually only "get" about half of what Frank shares with his fil=
es...his ears are definitely "tuned" differently, I think, hahaha. 
=C2=A0
=
-J
=C2=A0

>
> Very clear, Frank!
> =C3=82=C2=A0
> The first (forward) file is undeni=
able. I'm still wrapping my ears around the 2nd/reversed file.
> =C3=82=C2=
=A0
> Funny how we can always seem to find things we missed from these reco=
rdings. I've gone through a session half=C3=82=C2=A0a dozen times (or more =
in some cases)=C3=82=C2=A0and STILL=C3=82=C2=A0find volumes of things I mis=
sed with every new review. 
> =C3=82=C2=A0
> I know we miss the vast majori=
ty of this stuff in real time/during the session & recording...but good hel=
l!=C3=82=C2=A0 ;)
> =C3=82=C2=A0
> -J
>
